item.title: Others
item.description: MDMA Stimulant, Ecstasy, Hallucinogen, '3,4-methylenedioxy-N-methylamphetamine' Made from safrole, an oily liquid extracted from the bark or fruit of the sassafras tree History 1912 - Synthesised by German chemist Anton Kollisch, in an attempt to develop a haemostatic drug to stop abnormal bleeding 1970 - First report of recreational use of MDMA in the US 1970s - Pharmacist Alexander Shulgin synthesises MDMA and publishes reports of its mood enhancing effects and improvement of therapeutic engagement.
